general.name: Allan Dantas
general.title: Software Engineering Student
general.bio: Hi! I'm Allan Dantas, a software developer.

description.about: Software developer with solid experience in the complete web application lifecycle. With a full-stack foundation that provided a comprehensive view of system architecture, I now specialize in backend development. My focus is on building distributed and secure systems.

navigation.commands: Available commands: help, about, skills, projects, clear

skills.techIntro: My technical skills developed through École 42 and professional experience
skills.hardTechnical: At École 42, I developed strong skills in C/C++ programming, efficient algorithms, operating systems like Unix/Linux, networking and protocols, and web development using modern frameworks. These hard skills enable me to solve complex problems and collaborate in development teams.
skills.hardExperience: In addition to my studies at École 42, I have gained practical experience working at 42labs. This experience has allowed me to apply my technical skills in real-world projects, further enhancing my abilities in software development, debugging, and project management. Working in a collaborative environment at 42labs has also improved my communication and teamwork skills, making me a more effective and versatile developer.
skills.soft: Developed through École 42's peer-to-peer methodology and professional experience at 42Labs
skills.experienceIntro: My professional journey and the technologies I used in each experience

ciandt-analyst.title: Junior Systems Analyst
ciandt-analyst.description: Current work as Junior Systems Analyst at CI&T, developing solutions with modern technologies.

ciandt-intern.title: Software Engineering Intern
ciandt-intern.description: Developed and maintained scalable microservices using Java and Spring Boot, applying TDD and DDD practices. Worked on the conception, development and deployment of Artificial Intelligence agents with Python and Prompt Flow. Performed Agile Metrics analysis with Looker Studio and orchestrated automated data extraction with Google Apps Script.

fortytwo-rio.title: Software Developer
fortytwo-rio.description: Worked on the development and automation of processes for data ingestion, transformation and validation, optimizing the claims data area of Austral insurance company.

ruminante.title: Software Developer
ruminante.description: Developed and implemented web applications using a modern stack with React, Next.js, Tailwind CSS and Golang. This experience was fundamental to deepen my skills in software architecture, distributed systems design and creating responsive interfaces.

details.startedStudyingEcole42: In September 2023, I started studying software engineering at 42Rio, an innovative and challenging programming school, where I learned C/C++, algorithms, operating systems like Unix/Linux, networking and protocols, and web development with modern frameworks.
details.workingIn42Labs: In October 2024, I started working at 42Labs, on a project for the Austral insurance company, where I applied my technical knowledge to real projects, had the opportunity to work with technologies like Dagster, Python, Docker, Great expectations, among others.
details.workingInCI&T: In  2025, I started working at CI&T, a global technology and digital solutions company, where I continue to develop my technical skills and collaborate on challenging projects.

hackathon1.title: Vale | 42Rio Hackathon
hackathon1.description: We developed a solution to improve the mandatory onboarding training with the help of AI. The project involved creating an interactive platform that personalized training content based on user profiles and learning styles.

hackathon2.title: Modular Carnival Hackathon
hackathon2.description: We created P.A.G.A., a platform that uses Web3 to help with electoral promises monitoring. It was a challenging project, from the initial ideas to the implementation of smart contracts, Web3 wallet authentication, and decentralized storage. Through lots of ideas, code, and coffee, we transformed the concept into something functional and innovative.

fdf.title: Fdf - Fil de Fer
fdf.description: This project consists of graphically creating a schematic representation of a terrain in relief.
fdf.description1: FdF is a project in which we convert a file with a grid of height values into a 3D wireframe using a simple graphics library called MiniLibX.
fdf.description2: The rows of the grid represent the x-axis, the columns the y-axis, and the values the z-axis (altitude), creating a 3D wireframe representation.

philo.title: Philosophers
philo.description: The famous Dining Philosophers problem, all with the same basic rules.
philo.description1: This project is a training to multi-threads/multi-process programming with the use of mutex and semaphore. It contains 3 different programs simulating a twist of the famous Dining Philosophers problem, all with the same basic rules.
philo.description2: This project helps to understand the basics of functions in C. Great for improving knowledge in memory allocation and programming logic.

push_swap.title: Push Swap
push_swap.description: A project that involves sorting a list of integers using a limited set of operations.
push_swap.description1: The goal of the push_swap project is to sort a stack of integers using two stacks and a specific set of operations.
push_swap.description2: Stacks: The project involves two stacks, Stack A and Stack B, initially containing a random set of integers.
push_swap.description3: Operations: Students are required to implement a set of operations to manipulate the stacks.
push_swap.description4: Sorting Algorithm: The main challenge is to devise an algorithm that uses these operations to sort Stack A in ascending order.
push_swap.description5: Constraints: The project typically imposes constraints on the number of operations allowed, aiming for an efficient and optimized sorting algorithm.

minishell.title: Minishell
minishell.description: This project is about creating a simple shell. Yes, a little bash.
minishell.description1: Minishell is a project focused on creating a simple, minimalistic shell interface.
minishell.description2: It demonstrates basic command-line functionalities and a lightweight environment for user commands.
